channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: At 82, he’s as fit as a 20-year-old. His body holds clues to healthy aging.
item.description: Scientists are studying Juan López García, a world-record-holding ultramarathoner, to learn how we can stay healthy as we age.

item.title: Supreme Court clears way for California voting map that bolsters Democrats
item.description: The ruling is a major victory for the party as it seeks to offset a nationwide push by Republicans and Trump to redraw congressional maps to gain an advantage in this year’s midterm elections.

item.title: An album of the year winner in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Wednesday points.

item.title: Border czar Tom Homan says 700 ICE and CBP officers are leaving Minneapolis
item.description: The withdrawal decreases the federal footprint from about 3,000 agents to 2,300 — a significant scaling back but still much higher than the 80 who were in the Minneapolis area before Operation Metro Surge began Dec. 1, according to court records. The reduction in officers is effective immediately, he said.

item.title: Shutdown reprieve. Iranian drone. Columbus statue. Renée Good. Housing crisis. Super-ager. Best in show. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: How 6 of America’s oldest restaurants have lived on for over a century
item.description: At a time of great change in the restaurant industry — the world, actually — Tom Sietsema wanted to learn not just how these places have survived, but also how they thrive. As different as these six restaurants are, and despite their hardships, they share common threads.

item.title: House votes to end government shutdown, buy time for ICE talks
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security will be funded through Feb. 13 to allow for bipartisan negotiations over immigration enforcement.

item.title: U.S. shoots down suspected Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln
item.description: White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said the drone was “acting aggressively” when it approached the carrier, prompting commanders to order it shot down.

item.title: Pentagon warns Scouts to restore ‘core values’ or lose military support
item.description: The relationship dates back decades, but Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has criticized the organization for allowing girls to join and changing its name from Boy Scouts.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Drop ‘snarky’ colleague from trip, or will the fallout be worse?
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Drop ‘snarky’ colleague from trip, or will the fallout be worse?

item.title: How millions of everyday investors are getting a tax break
item.description: A watershed change by the SEC offers American savers a way to dodge the mutual fund surprise.

item.title: A new location in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Tuesday points.

item.title: Disney announces Josh D’Amaro to succeed Bob Iger as CEO
item.description: Iger returned in 2022 for a second stint as chief executive. D'Amaro currently leads Disney’s parks and resorts division.

item.title: Homeland Security is targeting Americans with a secretive legal weapon
item.description: Under President Donald Trump, the Department of Homeland Security has weaponized administrative subpoenas to attack free speech, according to privacy and civil rights groups.

item.title: Election powers. Epstein files. Measles cases. Kennedy Center. Iran talks. AI social network. Stair climbing. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: A bishop issued an edict to stand during Communion. The backlash speaks to a broader fight among U.S. Catholics.
item.description: Charlotte’s bishop, Michael Martin, decreed parishioners could no longer use kneelers and altar rails during the sacrament. Then 31 of the diocese’s 147 active priests sent a letter to the Vatican questioning their boss’s authority on the matter.

item.title: President says he's not ripping down the building, but some board members were blindsided by his proposal
item.description: When asked Monday by reporters whether he would demolish the building, President Donald Trump said, “I’m not ripping it down. I’ll be using the steel. ... We’re using some of the marble and some of the marble comes down.” The center’s staff learned of the planned closure Sunday through Trump's social media post. They received no official communication until the center’s president, Richard Grenell, later sent a copy of Trump’s Truth Social announcement to all employees.

item.title: Brendan Banfield found guilty of murdering wife in plot with au pair
item.description: The Virginia man accused of plotting with the family’s au pair to frame a stranger as his wife’s killer was found guilty of aggravated murder in the 2023 killings of Christine Banfield and Joseph Ryan. He was the last witness to testify in his own double murder trial.

item.title: Justice Department demotes Ed Martin, stripping Trump ally of most authority
item.description: Top Justice Department officials have stripped Martin of the bulk of his expansive responsibilities, leaving him on the sidelines of many of the controversial investigations he has championed, according to two people familiar with the personnel move. Martin will continue to serve as the department’s pardon attorney but will no longer work at its headquarters.

item.title: U.S. and India seal trade deal, Trump says, after months of tensions
item.description: The agreement calls for Washington to lower its 25 percent tariff on goods imported from India to 18 percent, with India reducing its tariffs on U.S. goods to zero, according to President Donald Trump. It is unclear if the additional 25 percent tariff Trump levied on New Delhi for its purchases of Russian oil in August will remain, though the president said Prime Minister Narendra Modi has also agreed to to stop “buying Russian Oil.”

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Caring for mom with dementia dredges up memories of childhood abuse
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Caring for mom with dementia dredges up memories of childhood abuse

item.title: The Democratic win in Texas was shocking, except for this
item.description: The midterm implications for Republicans could be less dire than they appear.

item.title: Insiders sounded alarms about Elon Musk’s Grok. Then the chatbot exploded with sexual content.
item.description: Under pressure to boost its popularity, Musk’s artificial intelligence start-up xAI loosened its guardrails and relaxed controls on sexual content, setting off internal concern.

item.title: A new addition to the National Film Registry in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Monday points.

item.title: The most important sound at this year’s Grammys? It was free speech, our critic writes.
item.description: With trophies in hand, Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish and SZA spoke out against ICE during an awards show where the musical performances felt secondary.

item.title: Kennedy Center. Government shutdown. ICE detentions. Dollar value. Epstein files. Grammys. Longevity tip. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Bad Bunny wins album of the year at the Grammy Awards while Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish and Olivia Dean notch big wins
item.description: The ceremony occasionally verged into politics, with several artists criticizing the Trump administration’s actions against immigrants.

item.title: Will the Grammys belong to Kendrick Lamar, Lady Gaga or KPop Demon Hunters? Follow our live coverage.
item.description: Sabrina Carpenter, Bad Bunny, Leon Bridges also lead in nominations on music's biggest night.

item.title: Trump plans to close Kennedy Center for about two years in July for construction
item.description: The president’s proposal calls for the center to undergo a full rebrand. It comes amid a series of cancellations and internal upheaval since he took over the storied institution nearly a year ago.

item.title: Meet the bird that can fly 8,000 miles without stopping
item.description: B6, a bar-tailed godwit, offers puffed-up humans a lesson in humility.

item.title: What I’ve held onto from knowing David Foster Wallace
item.description: On the 30th anniversary of “Infinite Jest,” a former assistant to the author’s editor looks back on a complicated mind and relationship.

item.title: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.
item.description: Play now to finish out your score for the week.

item.title: How well do you know Black history? Test your knowledge with this quiz.
item.description: Museums and other institutions continue to face pushback from the Trump administration over DEI, and states have passed laws limiting how teachers can discuss Black history in the classroom.

item.title: A mysterious delay in the Supreme Court tariffs case
item.description: The Trump administration, though the underdog, will find each passing week an encouraging sign.

item.title: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now
item.description: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now

item.title: Where to go in 2026, without crowds
item.description: 12 destinations to add to your travel wish list, from a Mexican mountain town to an accessible Greek island.

item.title: Judge orders release of 5-year-old detained by ICE in Minneapolis
item.description: Liam Conejo Ramos and his father were ordered released by a federal judge. The pair were detained in their driveway in Minnesota last week, sparking protests at the family detention center in Dilley, Texas, where they have been held.

item.title: Adding this much exercise to your daily routine may boost longevity
item.description: Using activity tracker data, researchers found that just a bit more exercise could save one in 10 people from an earlier death.

item.title: Judge won’t scale back Trump’s immigration surge in Minnesota for now
item.description: Minnesota officials had said the immigration crackdown was endangering public safety in their state.

item.title: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.
item.description: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.

item.title: The ‘Melania’ documentary promises to take us behind the scenes. There’s nothing to see, our critic writes.
item.description: The new film about the elusive first lady mostly underscores her impenetrability.

item.title: Trump wants to build a 250-foot-tall arch, dwarfing the Lincoln Memorial
item.description: The president is eying a plot of land near Memorial Bridge. The art critic who proposed the idea called for a smaller arch or for Trump to pick a new site.

item.title: Senate passes funding deal, but short-term shutdown still expected
item.description: A temporary funding lapse will start Saturday before the House returns to consider the agreement early next week.

item.title: Catherine O’Hara dies at 71. The Canadian-born actress starred in ‘Schitt’s Creek’ and ‘Home Alone.’
item.description: O’Hara partnered with Christopher Guest for a series of beloved mockumentaries and gained a new generation of fans as a vain former soap-opera star on “Schitt’s Creek.”

item.title: Carolyn Hax chat: My husband is a liar and a thief. I don’t want to tell my family.
item.description: Carolyn Hax chat: My husband is a liar and a thief. I don’t want to tell my family.

item.title: Justice Department says it opened civil rights investigation into Alex Pretti’s shooting
item.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche’s announcement signals an apparent shift from its handling so far of shootings involving agents.

item.title: Luigi Mangione won’t face death penalty in case of UnitedHealthcare CEO’s killing
item.description: Mangione will not face the death penalty on charges of stalking and killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in late 2024, a federal judge ruled Friday.

item.title: Don Lemon arrested by federal officials over church protest
item.description: The former CNN host was taken into custody in Los Angeles.

item.title: Trump taps Fed critic Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as chairman
item.description: The Wall Street veteran once held hawkish views on interest rates but has recently signaled a stance more in line with President Trump’s public demands.

item.title: Shutdown deadline. Anger in Minnesota. ICE warehouses. Tulsi Gabbard. ‘Melania’ premiere. Nor’easter. Slower aging. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.
